Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: MEDIA TYPE: The media type (also known as mud type or drilling fluid type) presentin the wellbore. For example chemical gel mud, crude oil, native mud...
Column Comment.3: DEPTH OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the depth or interval.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: CASING DEPTH: Depth of the deepest casing set when the drilling media enteredthe hole.
Column Comment.6: CASING DEPTH OUOM: Casing depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.7: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.8: END DATE: the last date that this information is in effect.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.10: MAXIMUM MUD WEIGHT: Value for the maximum weight of the drilling media usedwithin the interval.
Column Comment.11: MAXIMUM MUD WEIGHT OUOM: Maximum weight original unit of measure.
Column Comment.12: MAXIMUM MUD WEIGHT UNITS OF MEASURE: the reported data for max mudweight is usually provided as PPG (Pounds per gallon) or LB/CF.
Column Comment.13: MAXIMUM MUD WEIGHT DEPTH: Measured depth at which the maximum mediaweight was recorded within the interval.
Column Comment.14: MAXIMUM MUD WEIGHT DEPTH OUOM: Maximum media weight depth originalunit of measure.
Column Comment.15: MUD END DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface point to the point where theoperator ceased using or changed the mud/drilling media.
Column Comment.16: MUD END DEPTH OUOM: Mud end depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.17: MUD START DEPTH: Measured depth from the surface to the point where theoperator started using or changed the mud/drilling media.
Column Comment.18: MUD START DEPTH OUOM: Mud start depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.19: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.21: START DATE: the first date that this mud information is in effect.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.23: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.25: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.28: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
